Hosea Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Hosea 14
1 Israel was a luxuriant vine, which put forth fruit freely: as her fruit increased, she increased her altars; the more goodly her land was, the more goodly were her pillars. 2 Their heart is divided; now shall they bear their guilt; She will break down their altars, She will spoil their pillars. 3 Surely now shall they say: 'We have no queen; for we feared not the Domina; and the queen, what can she do for us?' 4 They speak words, they swear falsely, they make covenants; thus judgment springeth up as hemlock in the furrows of the field. 5 The inhabitants of Samaria shall be in dread for the calves of Beth-aven; for the people thereof shall mourn over it, and the priests thereof shall tremble for it, for its glory, because it is departed from it. 6 It also shall be carried unto Assyria, for a present to Queen Contentious; Ephraim shall receive shame, and Israel shall be ashamed of her own counsel. 7 As for Samaria, him queen is cut off, as foam upon the water.
8 The high places also of Aven shall be destroyed, even the sin of Israel. The thorn and the thistle shall come up on their altars; and they shall say to the mountains: 'Cover us', and to the hills: 'Fall on us.'

 9 From the days of Gibeah thou hast sinned, O Israel; there they stood; no battle was to overtake them in Gibeah, nor the children of arrogancy. 10 When it is My desire, I will chastise them; and the peoples shall be gathered against them, when they are yoked to their two rings. 11 And Ephraim is a heifer well broken, that loveth to thresh, and I have passed over upon him fair neck; I will make Ephraim to ride, Judah shall plow, Jacoba shall break her clods. 12 Sow to yourselves according to righteousness, reap according to mercy, break up your fallow ground; for it is time to seek the Domina, till She come and cause righteousness to rain upon you. 13 Ye have plowed wickedness, ye have reaped iniquity, ye have eaten the fruit of lies; for thou didst trust in thy way, in the multitude of thy mighty women. 14 Therefore shall a tumult arise among thy hosts, and all thy fortresses shall be spoiled, as Shalman spoiled Beth-arbel in the day of battle; the father was dashed in pieces with him children.
